title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 8, ch. II, subch. L, pt. 175 - State Aid
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 8, ch. II, subch. L, pt. 175 - State Aid

State Regulations
§ 175.1 - Attendance periods of school year for state aid purposes
§ 175.2 - Attendance records for examination days for State aid purposes
§ 175.3 - Computation of resident weighted average daily attendance and total wealth pupil units
§ 175.4 - School attendance affected by epidemics, or manmade or natural disaster, or act of terrorism
§ 175.5 - Minimum instructional hours and use of superintendents' conference days for State aid purposes
§ 175.6 - Calculation of student attendance for students with disabilities, for incarcerated youth enrolled in approved educational programs pursuant to part 118 of this title and for homeless children attending the school district of current location or a school district participating in an approved regional placement plan pursuant to section 100.2(x) of this title
§ 175.7 - Repealed
§ 175.8 - State reimbursement for education of certain pupils
§ 175.9 - Transportation aid for providing transportation assistant services to pupils with handicapping conditions
§ 175.10 - Statute of limitations on state aid payments
§ 175.11 - Attendance in public school programs for certain pupils with disabilities
§ 175.12 - Approved expenditures for programs for education of certain pupils with disabilities
§ 175.13 - Computation of attendance and membership for certain pupils with disabilities who attend boces classes
§ 175.14 - Repealed
§ 175.15 - Expenditures for purposes of computation of state aid
§ 175.16 - Computation of statewide average approved operating expense per total aidable pupil unit
§ 175.17 - Approval of computer services expenses in school districts in cities having a population in excess of 125,000 and any other school district which was not a component of a board of cooperative educational services in the base year
§ 175.18 - Repealed
§ 175.19 - Repealed
§ 175.20 - Repealed
§ 175.21 - Instruction of pupils cared for in hospitals or other institutions which provide for care, custody and treatment of children for purposes of state aid
§ 175.22 - Repealed
§ 175.23 - Repealed
§ 175.24 - Voluntary interdistrict urban-suburban transfer program
§ 175.25 - Approval of expenses for the purchase, lease or repair of computer hardware
§ 175.26 - Repealed
§ 175.27 - Repealed
§ 175.28 - Aid for pupils with special educational needs
§ 175.29 - Repealed
§ 175.31 - Repealed
§ 175.32 - Repealed
§ 175.33 - Repealed
§ 175.34 - Repealed
§ 175.35 - Excellence in teaching apportionments for school districts and boards of cooperative educational services
§ 175.36 - Repealed
§ 175.37 - Youth incarcerated in county correctional facilities apportionment
§ 175.38 - Repealed
§ 175.39 - Reporting of instructional expense
§ 175.40 - School attendance affected by religious holiday observance
§ 175.41 - Analysis of average interest rates applied to capital debt incurred by the city of new york for school purposes, or by the new york city transitional finance authority for school purposes if no such capital debt is incurred by the city of new york, for use in the apportionment of building aid to the city school district of the city of new york
§ 175.42 - Apportionment of moneys during the first school year of a reorganization of school districts as a result of the partitioning of territory and formation of new school districts by district superintendents when the effective date of such reorganization is after july first
§ 175.43 - Repealed
§ 175.44 - Repealed

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 8, ch. II, subch. L, pt. 175

Statutory authority: Education Law, §§101, 207, 215, 305, 3202, 3601-a, 3602 as amd. by § 27 of ch. 82, L. 1995, 3602[1][d], 3602-f, 3604, 3609-c as added by § 75, ch. 474, L. 1996; L. 1992, ch. 53, § 41; L. 1993, ch. 57, §§ 375, 377, 395; L. 1993, ch. 260, §§ 10, 12, 13, 14; L. 1994, ch. 170, §§ 492-b, 502; L. 1996, ch. 474, §§ 27, 29, 38, 68, 69; L. 1999, ch. 405, part L, §§ 44, 83-a; L. 2000, ch. 60, part A, § 12; L. 2003, ch. 62; L. 2004, ch. 57; L. 2005, ch. 53; L. 2006, ch. 53; L. 2007, ch. 57

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
